section.name: Where to get it?
section.p: Pustefix can be downloaded from SourceForge. Alternatively, you can checkout from CVS. The files to download are shown in the table below.

td.p: Contains an pustefix environment with all you need develop pustefix application. Download this if you are new to pustefix.

Contains the pustefix core with all java classes and the necessary XML/XSLT files. Usually, you will download an pustefix environment which includes the core. Download these files if you already have an pustefix environment and want to upgrade it to the latest core.

subsection.name: Prerequisites
subsection.p: There are a few things you need to have installed prior to using Pustefix. See the table below for references. Note that we changed our skeleton distribution to no longer include Tomcat, you now have to dowload it from jakarta.apache.org.

tr.td: Yes, java should be platform independent. Unfortunately portions of the build environment and code are unix specific. Although these platform independant portions mainly deal with file system path secifications - they exist. There may be even more places where the thing wouldn't work on win32.
The Java 2 Platform, Standard Edition (aka Java Development Kit) in version 1.4.1 or higher.

The tomcat servlet container. You need to get this together with the skeleton package to have a complete pustefix environment. We currently develop against tomcat-5.0.27. Please note that you need to download the binary package in the form of a gzipped tar file (.tar.gz). Don't unpack it, just put the downloaded package in the directory ./lib/tomcat of the unpacked skeleton distribution. There's also a README file in the directory that may contain other helpful information.

Apache Ant, the Java-based build tool in version 1.6.2 or higher. If you have really large projects consider increasing the memory for the java vm ant runs in: Set the ANT_OPTS environment variable to something like "-mx200m". This variable is evaluated within the ant start script contained in the ant distribution.

td.p: Optional: Jikes is a blazingly fast java compiler from IBM. Pustefix is pre-configured to use jikes, so you need to install it in order for the build system to work out of the box. Important You don't have to install jikes. In this case, please set the ant property build.compiler to modern when calling ant.
